reviewText: This is a lecture series, which by definition involves a professor standing  in front of  the camera  giving lectures. But what a professor! Victor Davis Hanson is a premier military historian, and offers some insights that contravene accepted "truths" about the war. However, as it is an abbreviated overview,  it assumes a fair amount of  prior knowledge about WW2.
complete waste of time and money.the whole thing is a guy standing there looking like a professor telling us about the war.i shut it off after 20 mins.
Anything that involves VDH is first rate and accurate!
This program is a lecture format with the narrator explaining aspects of the war. Great if you are interested from an academic perspective, bad from an entertainment perspective.
Content is great, video quality is good overall.
It's a video lecture series instead of a documentary. Okay. Not great.
This was given a negative review because it's a lecture series but that makes it so much better than just a documentary.
Well done. Many industrial, political, and strategic dimensions that I was unaware of. Very nice high altitude perspective of WWII. Fascinating, thank you VDH.
